ExtJS Beginners: Easy Steps to setup ExtJS workspace with multiple application

Prerequisites:

  • Extjs SDK, library folder; if you dont have download 30 days trial version from sencha website
  • Extjs CMD, download from sencha website

Steps: Open sencha CMD, and follow the steps [By using "sencha generate workspace workspace_name"]

  1. G:\>sencha generate workspace myworkspace
    2. Now your workspace directory is created with name myworkspace inside G:\ folder, And you have to create application inside this workspace. Remember that this workspace does not have sencha library folder yet. And we will create that while creating the application.

  2. G:\>cd myworkspace
    3. Now we will create a app named "lms" inside myworkspace. By executing the below command it will automatically check the SDK directory "ext"; since we don't have ext directory it will automatically create the directory very first time and it will place the extjs library required files. [ message will start like "Workspace does not have framework ext at G:\myworkspace ... copying"] And then it will create app "lms".

  3. G:\myworkspace>sencha -sdk c:\ext-6.0.2 generate app lms G:\myworkspace\lms
    4. Now you are done with setup of workspace and app. If you wish to see the application execute the following command and open the browser to confirm. [localhost:1841/lms/].

  4. G:\myworkspace>sencha web start
    5. If you want to and another app inside workspace; you can simple add the following command and it will create the app:

  5. G:\myworkspace>sencha -sdk ext generate app qms g:\myworkspace\qms

Now you can start adding applications and begin your work. !!!

Date: 15:57 IST; Feb 22, 2017.
